text:
Tourists choosing this type of stay more Article By: Megan Ellis Tue, 11 Aug 2015 8:47 AM Share Your Email Tourists are choosing a more social way of traveling. A B&B offers the personal experience they are seeking. Credit: PRNewsWire/Bed & Breakfast Europe 
A certain type of accommodation is showing strong growth, becoming increasingly popular for travellers worldwide, a website shows. 
So what type of accommodation is significantly increasing in popularity? 
None other than the classic Bed & Breakfast. 
This is according to statistics by the world's largest B&B website, Bedandbreakfast.eu. 
The first seven months of 2015 showed a 39% growth in reservations, compared with the same period last year. 
Meanwhile, the number of rooms and apartments on the site increased by 18%. 
But what is driving this growth? Apparently, value for money. 
"B&Bs are cheaper than hotels, but offer the same comfort," the site's founder Hanny Arens said in a statement. 
Another driver for growth is the personal feel of B&Bs. 
"A clear trend is that tourists are choosing a more social way of travelling. They want to spend the night at a local's and truly get to know an area. A B&B offers the personal experience they are seeking," Arens said.
